explains: adj. 完全开放的；取缔不严的

sentences.en: She had a fear of wide-open spaces.
sentences.cn: 身处开阔的空地中会使她感到害怕。

sentences.en: The child had left the inner door wide open.
sentences.cn: 这个孩子让里面的门大开着。

sentences.en: The first inkling I had that something was wrong was when I found the front door wide open.
sentences.cn: 我发现前门大开着时就隐约感觉到出了事。
